unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Southpaws and $p$-Values
question_text: People who are left-handed are sometimes referred to as “southpaws”. According to some reports $10\%$ of people are left-handed, but Billy doesn't believe this is true and decides to do a study. He randomly selects $130$ people and finds that $20$ of them are left-handed. What is the $p$ -value for the appropriate significance test?

choices.text: We cannot conduct a significance test because conditions for doing so are not satisfied in this situation.
